hero.title: Contact Form
hero.subtitle: // API, Resend, Zod and rate limit
hero.description: How this project implements the contact form: validation with Zod, rate limit, reCAPTCHA and sending with Resend. Code examples to replicate in your project.

overview.title: What we use
overview.subtitle: // contact form stack
overview.description: The form sends data to a Next.js API route. The route validates the payload with Zod, applies rate limit per IP, optionally reCAPTCHA, and sends the email via Resend. Error messages come from translations (i18n).
overview.stack: Resend (sending), Zod (validation), in-memory or Redis rate limit, reCAPTCHA v3. Code in src/app/api/contact and src/features/home/contact.
overview.codeTitle: Zod schema for name, email and message

flow.title: Message flow
flow.subtitle: // from form to email
flow.description: The user fills name, email and message on the client. The front end sends POST to /api/contact. The API validates with Zod, checks rate limit and reCAPTCHA (if configured), and calls Resend to send the email.
flow.steps: On error, the API returns a clear message; the front displays it without exposing internal details. Labels and messages come from translations (a11y and i18n).

libs.title: Sending libraries
libs.subtitle: // Resend, Nodemailer, React Email
libs.description: Some options to send email from the Next.js API: Resend (used in this project), Nodemailer (direct SMTP), React Email (React templates). Below, how to implement in the API route with Resend and with Nodemailer.
libs.resendDesc: Modern API, great DX, used in this project. Key in RESEND_API_KEY.
libs.nodemailerDesc: Node classic: sends via SMTP (Gmail, Outlook, your server).
libs.reactEmailDesc: Email templates in React; generates HTML and can use Resend or Nodemailer to send.

api.title: API route and security
api.subtitle: // POST /api/contact
api.description: The route reads the body, validates with the Zod schema, applies rate limit per IP and, if ok, calls Resend with the key from an environment variable. Never expose RESEND_API_KEY on the client.
api.tip: To replicate: create the API route, define the Zod schema, use rate limit (middleware or lib) and set RESEND_API_KEY in .env. Success and error messages via translations (i18n and a11y).
